#' @method resid oomglm #' @export resid.oomglm <- function(object, data, type = c("deviance" , "pearson" , "response" , "working"), as_function = FALSE, ...) residuals.oomglm(object, data, type, as_function) calculate residuals for `oomglm`` model

residuals.oomglm.Rd

Returns the difference between actual and predicted values. oomglm models do not store data while fitting. The data must be supplied to residual() calls.

# S3 method for oomglm
residuals(object, data, type = c("deviance", "pearson",
  "response", "working"), as_function = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

object

oomglm model
data

data containing values used for residual calculation
type

residual calculation method
as_function

if TRUE a function with only a data argument is returned for subsequent residual calculations
...

ignored

See also

oomglm()
